title: Port Sarim

properties.name: description
properties.value: Port Sarim is a town in south-eastern Asgarnia. With its notable port facilities, Port Sarim offers a gateway to many exotic locations, including Entrana, Karamja, Crandor, Great Kourend, Corsair Cove, and Pest Control. Many other destinations are offered via the charter ship. There is also a fishing, food, jewellery, magic, and battleaxe shop along with a jail.

Port Sarim is a town in south-eastern Asgarnia. With its notable port facilities, Port Sarim offers a gateway to many exotic locations, including Entrana, Karamja, Crandor, Great Kourend, Corsair Cove, and Pest Control. Many other destinations are offered via the charter ship. There is also a fishing, food, jewellery, magic, and battleaxe shop along with a jail.

Contents

  • 1 Travel
  • 2 Quests
  • 3 Features
    • 3.1 Monsters
    • 3.2 Farm
    • 3.3 Rimmington mine
    • 3.4 Altar
    • 3.5 Thurgo's Peninsula/Mudskipper Point
  • 4 Stores
    • 4.1 Betty's Magic Emporium
    • 4.2 Grum's Gold Exchange
    • 4.3 Brian's Battleaxe Bazaar
    • 4.4 Gerrant's Fishy Business
    • 4.5 Wydin's Food Store
  • 5 The port
    • 5.1 North jetty
    • 5.2 Centre jetty
    • 5.3 South jetty
    • 5.4 The Void Knights
    • 5.5 Trader Stan
    • 5.6 The bank deposit
  • 6 Changes

Travel[edit | edit source]

  • Using the grouping interface to teleport to the Rat Pits minigame (requires completion of the Ratcatchers quest).
  • Use an explorer's ring 2/3/4 to teleport to the cabbage patch, then run south.
  • Use the Pest Control minigame teleport and travel to Port Sarim via the north dock for free.
  • Use an amulet of glory to teleport to Draynor Village, then run west.
  • Use an amulet of glory to teleport to Karamja, then run south-east and talk to the customs officer and pay him 30 coins to sail to Port Sarim.
  • Use the fairy ring aiq, then run north.
  • If the player's house is in Rimmington, they can Teleport to House, then run east.
  • Run south from Falador.
  • Use the Draynor Manor Teleport, then run south-west.
  • Run south from the Barbarian Village.
  • Teleport to a player-planted spirit tree, just east of the pub (requires 83 Farming and completion of the Tree Gnome Village quest).

Quests[edit | edit source]

Port Sarim has two quests, both of which are free-to-play:

  • Pirate's Treasure may be started by talking to Redbeard Frank who is located to the south just outside of the bar.
  • The Corsair Curse may be started by talking to Captain Tock at the crossroads north of Port Sarim.

Features[edit | edit source]

Monsters[edit | edit source]

Thieves, goblins, seagulls, men, women, and rats can all be found roaming around the port and near vicinity.

Farm[edit | edit source]

Located between Port Sarim and Falador, the farm has chickens, cows, and a cabbage field. Two eggs can be found in the chicken coop, and a sink can be found on the east side of the farm. Members can access a farming shop here and use the loom in the south-east room. There are pigs and piglets on the farm, though they can not be attacked. In the north-eastern field of the farm are several allotment patches, notably for beginning farmers.

Rimmington mine[edit | edit source]

The Rimmington mine can be found by walking west from the port.

Altar[edit | edit source]

An altar can be found inside a church by walking south-west from the jail. It is a very small church with an altar in it. It isn't known which NPC - if any - runs the church; it appears completely abandoned, with lit pew candles and a small road to a maintained graveyard. Many players use the altar here on their way to the Asgarnian Ice Dungeon to kill Skeletal Wyverns.

Thurgo's Peninsula/Mudskipper Point[edit | edit source]

Thurgo's Peninsula and Mudskipper Point can both be found by walking south from the port. Here, a player may find the Imcando dwarf Thurgo who plays a major role in the The Knight's Sword quest. The entrance to the Asgarnian Ice Dungeon, the only known place in RuneScape to contain blurite ore, can be found just east of Thurgo's hut. The fairy ring code aiq takes players to the end of the peninsula, the Slayer location in which mogres may be found.

Stores[edit | edit source]

Betty's Magic Emporium[edit | edit source]

Betty's Magic Emporium may be found on the north-western most part of the port. Betty runs the store and sells Magic items. Players may purchase runes, eye of newts, and blue and black wizard hats.

Grum's Gold Exchange[edit | edit source]

Grum's Gold Exchange is located directly south of Betty's Magic Emporium. Grum runs the store and sells various jewellery. Players can purchase rings, necklaces, and strung amulets. The store is stocked only by other players selling their jewellery.

Brian's Battleaxe Bazaar[edit | edit source]

Brian's Battleaxe Bazaar is located east of Grum's Gold Exchange. Brian runs the store and sells battleaxes. Players may purchase battleaxes from bronze to adamant, including black, though the higher tiered battleaxes are usually sold out.

Gerrant's Fishy Business[edit | edit source]

Gerrant's Fishy Business can be found a bit south of Grum's Gold Exchange. Gerrant runs the store and sells raw fish and fishing equipment. Players may purchase all free-to-play fishing equipment here, fishing bait, feathers, and raw fish that are available to free-to-play players from shrimps all the way to swordfish. On the north wall of the store, a white apron spawns.

Wydin's Food Store[edit | edit source]

Wydin's Food Store is directly south of Gerrant's Fishy Business. The store is owned by Wydin who sells various food items. The store plays an important role in the Pirate's Treasure quest. Players may also be hired as a worker for Wydin once they reach a certain point in the quest.

The port[edit | edit source]

North jetty[edit | edit source]

Members may charter a boat trip to Entrana. The monks will not allow you to carry weapons or armour. However, it seems players may get away with raw materials to fletch a bow and arrows or to craft leather armour. Magic runes are also allowed.

Members may speak to Veos, located directly south of the Rusty Anchor Inn, to be transported for free to either Port Piscarilius or Land's End, both of which are in Great Kourend. There are no quest requirements for this service.

Centre jetty[edit | edit source]

Players may charter a ship to travel to Karamja for a price of 30 coins. There is a right-click option on any of the sailors to "Pay fare." This allows for travel without the need to manoeuvre dialogue menus.

South jetty[edit | edit source]

The Lady Lumbridge, in need of repair until the player fixes the hull during the Dragon Slayer I quest, is docked here. Players may use this ship to sail to Crandor.

The Void Knights[edit | edit source]

A few Void Knight squires may be found on the southern side of the south jetty. Talk to the squire to go to the Void Knights' Outpost where you can play the Pest Control minigame.

Trader Stan[edit | edit source]

Trader Stan and crew are on the southernmost jetty. They have many things to trade with any adventurer, including the Tyras helm. They will also allow members to use the charter ships to travel to many other ports. After completing Cabin Fever, the charter ship fare is reduced by 50%. Wearing the ring of charos(a) also reduces the fare by 50%. These two bonuses can be stacked to reduce the cost to 25%.

Fare table
Destination Cost
Brimhaven 1,600
Catherby 1,000
Corsair Cove 1,200
Musa Point N/A
Mos Le'Harmless 650[t 1]
Port Khazard 1,280
Port Phasmatys 1,300
Port Sarim N/A
Port Tyras 3,200
Ship Yard 400
Prifddinas 4,800
  1. ^ Since travel to and from Mos Le'Harmless requires Cabin Fever to be completed anyway, the cost is already halved.

The bank deposit[edit | edit source]

The only bank deposit in this city is located next to the monks (just south of Redbeard Frank). This is very useful for free-to-play users fishing for lobsters, tuna etc in Karamja. In addition, many low-level free-to-play users mining in the Rimmington mine find this deposit box just as useful. It saves you from walking all the way to the Draynor Village bank (north-east of Port Sarim).

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
5 March 2015
(update | poll)

There is now a shortcut between Draynor Village and Port Sarim that you can use at level 43 agility if you have completed the Medium Lumbridge & Draynor Diary.

15 August 2013
(update | poll)

A bank deposit box has been added to the Port Sarim pier by the Entrana ferry.

22 February 2013
(update)

This content was included when the Old School RuneScape servers officially launched.

'''Port Sarim''' is a town in south-eastern [[Asgarnia]]. With its notable port facilities, Port Sarim offers a gateway to many exotic locations, including [[Entrana]], [[Karamja]], [[Crandor]], [[Great Kourend]], [[Corsair Cove]], and [[Pest Control]]. Many other destinations are offered via the [[charter ship]]. There is also a [[Gerrant's Fishy Business|fishing]], [[Wydin's Food Store|food]], [[Grum's Gold Exchange|jewellery]], [[Betty's Magic Emporium|magic]], and [[Brian's Battleaxe Bazaar|battleaxe shop]] along with a [[Port Sarim Jail|jail]].

==Travel==
*Using the [[grouping]] interface to teleport to the [[Rat Pits]] [[minigame]] (requires completion of the [[Ratcatchers]] quest).
*Use an [[explorer's ring 2]]/[[Explorer's ring 3|3]]/[[Explorer's ring 4|4]] to teleport to the [[cabbage patch]], then run south.
*Use the [[Pest Control]] [[minigame teleport]] and travel to Port Sarim via the north dock for free.
*Use an [[amulet of glory]] to teleport to [[Draynor Village]], then run west.
*Use an [[amulet of glory]] to teleport to [[Karamja]], then run south-east and talk to the [[customs officer]] and pay him {{NoCoins|30|c}} to sail to Port Sarim.
*Use the [[fairy ring]] {{Fairycode|aiq}}, then run north.
*If the player's house is in [[Rimmington]], they can [[Teleport to House]], then run east.
*Run south from [[Falador]].
*Use the [[Draynor Manor Teleport]], then run south-west.
*Run south from the [[Barbarian Village]].
*Teleport to a player-planted [[spirit tree]], just east of the [[Rusty Anchor Inn|pub]] (requires 83 [[Farming]] and completion of the [[Tree Gnome Village]] quest).

==Quests==
Port Sarim has two [[quests]], both of which are [[free-to-play]]:

*[[Pirate's Treasure]] may be started by talking to [[Redbeard Frank]] who is located to the south just outside of the [[Rusty Anchor Inn|bar]].
*[[The Corsair Curse]] may be started by talking to [[Captain Tock]] at the crossroads north of Port Sarim.

==Features==
===Monsters===
[[Thief|Thieves]], [[goblin]]s, [[seagull]]s, [[Man|men]], [[Woman|women]], and [[rat]]s can all be found roaming around the port and near vicinity.

===Farm===
Located between Port Sarim and [[Falador]], the farm has [[chicken]]s, [[cow]]s, and a [[cabbage]] field. Two [[egg]]s can be found in the chicken coop, and a [[sink]] can be found on the east side of the farm. [[Members]] can access a [[Sarah's Farming Shop|farming shop]] here and use the [[loom]] in the south-east room. There are pigs and piglets on the farm, though they can not be attacked. In the north-eastern field of the farm are several [[allotment]] patches, notably for beginning farmers.

===Rimmington mine===
The [[Rimmington mine]] can be found by walking west from the port.

===Altar===
An [[altar]] can be found inside a [[church]] by walking south-west from the [[Port Sarim Jail|jail]]. It is a very small church with an altar in it. It isn't known which [[Non-player character|NPC]] - if any - runs the church; it appears completely abandoned, with lit pew candles and a small road to a maintained graveyard. Many players use the altar here on their way to the [[Asgarnian Ice Dungeon]] to kill [[Skeletal Wyvern]]s.

===Thurgo's Peninsula/Mudskipper Point===
Thurgo's Peninsula and [[Mudskipper Point]] can both be found by walking south from the port. Here, a player may find the [[Imcando dwarf]] [[Thurgo]] who plays a major role in the [[The Knight's Sword]] [[quest]]. The entrance to the [[Asgarnian Ice Dungeon]], the only known place in ''[[Old School RuneScape|RuneScape]]'' to contain [[blurite ore]], can be found just east of Thurgo's hut. The [[fairy ring]] code {{Fairycode|aiq}} takes players to the end of the peninsula, the [[Slayer]] location in which [[mogre]]s may be found.

==Stores==
===Betty's Magic Emporium===
[[Betty's Magic Emporium]] may be found on the north-western most part of the port. [[Betty]] runs the store and sells [[Magic]] [[items]]. Players may purchase [[runes]], [[eye of newt]]s, and blue and black [[wizard hat]]s.

===Grum's Gold Exchange===
[[Grum's Gold Exchange]] is located directly south of [[Betty's Magic Emporium]]. [[Grum]] runs the store and sells various [[jewellery]]. Players can purchase [[ring]]s, [[necklace]]s, and strung [[amulet]]s. The store is stocked only by other players selling their jewellery.

===Brian's Battleaxe Bazaar===
[[Brian's Battleaxe Bazaar]] is located east of [[Grum's Gold Exchange]]. [[Brian]] runs the store and sells [[battleaxe]]s. Players may purchase battleaxes from [[bronze battleaxe|bronze]] to [[adamant battleaxe|adamant]], including [[black battleaxe|black]], though the higher tiered battleaxes are usually sold out.

===Gerrant's Fishy Business===
[[Gerrant's Fishy Business]] can be found a bit south of [[Grum's Gold Exchange]]. [[Gerrant]] runs the store and sells raw [[fish]] and [[fishing]] equipment. Players may purchase all [[free-to-play]] fishing equipment here, [[fishing bait]], [[feather]]s, and raw fish that are available to free-to-play players from [[Raw shrimps|shrimps]] all the way to [[Raw swordfish|swordfish]]. On the north wall of the store, a [[white apron]] [[Spawning|spawns]].

===Wydin's Food Store===
[[Wydin's Food Store]] is directly south of [[Gerrant's Fishy Business]]. The store is owned by [[Wydin]] who sells various [[food]] [[items]]. The store plays an important role in the [[Pirate's Treasure]] [[quest]]. Players may also be hired as a worker for Wydin once they reach a certain point in the quest.

==The port==

===North jetty===
[[Members]] may [[Charter ship|charter a boat trip]] to [[Entrana]]. The monks will not allow you to carry [[weapons]] or [[armour]]. However, it seems players may get away with raw materials to [[Fletching|fletch]] a [[bow]] and [[arrows]] or to [[Crafting|craft]] [[leather armour]]. Magic [[runes]] are also allowed.

[[Members]] may speak to [[Veos]], located directly south of the [[Rusty Anchor Inn]], to be transported for free to either [[Port Piscarilius]] or [[Land's End]], both of which are in [[Great Kourend]]. There are no quest requirements for this service.

===Centre jetty===
Players may [[Charter ship|charter a ship]] to travel to [[Karamja]] for a price of 30 [[coins]]. There is a right-click option on any of the sailors to "Pay fare." This allows for travel without the need to manoeuvre dialogue menus.

===South jetty===
The [[Lady Lumbridge]], in need of repair until the player fixes the hull during the [[Dragon Slayer I]] [[Quests|quest]], is docked here. Players may use this ship to sail to [[Crandor]].

===The Void Knights===
A few [[Void Knight squire]]s may be found on the southern side of the south jetty. Talk to the squire to go to the [[Void Knights' Outpost]] where you can play the [[Pest Control]] [[minigame]].

===Trader Stan===
[[Trader Stan]] and crew are on the southernmost jetty. They have many things to trade with any adventurer, including the [[Tyras helm]]. They will also allow members to use the [[charter ship]]s to travel to many other ports. After completing [[Cabin Fever]], the charter ship fare is reduced by 50%. Wearing the [[ring of charos(a)]] also reduces the fare by 50%. These two bonuses can be stacked to reduce the cost to 25%.

===The bank deposit===
The only [[Bank deposit box|bank deposit]] in this city is located next to the monks (just south of [[Redbeard Frank]]). This is very useful for [[free-to-play]] users fishing for [[Raw lobster|lobsters]], [[Raw tuna|tuna]] etc in [[Karamja]]. In addition, many low-level free-to-play users [[mining]] in the [[Rimmington mine]] find this deposit box just as useful. It saves you from walking all the way to the [[Draynor Village]] [[bank]] (north-east of Port Sarim).
